title: Lucius Cornelius Merula (consul 193 BC)
text: Lucius Cornelius L. f. Merula was <a href="Roman%20consul">consul</a> of the <a href="Roman%20Republic">Roman Republic</a>, along with <a href="Quintus%20Minucius%20Thermus%20%28consul%20193%20BC%29">Quintus Minucius Thermus</a>, in 193 BC. His province was <a href="Gallia%20Cisalpina">Gallia Cisalpina</a>. Merula closed an active predatory campaign by a total defeat of the <a href="Boii">Boian</a> Gauls in the neighbourhood of <a href="Modena">Mutina</a>. Since his staff officer <a href="Marcus%20Claudius%20Marcellus%20%28consul%20196%20BC%29">Marcus Claudius Marcellus</a> accused him of a delay in sending forward a reserve unit, resulting in several thousand unnecessary casualties and the escape of many enemy soldiers, the <a href="Roman%20Senate">senate</a> refused him a <a href="Roman%20triumph">triumph</a>.
